data.title: Linear equation
data.statement:
A linear equation is of the form of y = a*x + b.
You have to find the equation of the line between the point A ([[xa]],[[ya]]) and the point B ([[xb]],[[yb]]) and if a point ([[x]],[[y]]) is on this line.

<<Note :>> As the line represented by the linear equation extends indefinitely in both directions, a point is considered to be on the line even if it lies outside the segment (A,B).

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

A linear equation is of the form of y = a*x + b.
You have to find the equation of the line between the point A (xa,ya) and the point B (xb,yb) and if a point (x,y) is on this line.

Note : As the line represented by the linear equation extends indefinitely in both directions, a point is considered to be on the line even if it lies outside the segment (A,B).
Input
Line 1 : Four integers separated by a space xa xb ya yb representing the coordinates of the point A (xa,ya) and the point B (xb,yb).
Line 2-6 : Each line contains two space-separated integers for the coordinates to the point to test (x,y) if it is on the line (A,B).
Output
Line(s) : One output line per point on the line (A,B), with the text The point (x,y) is on the line (A,B).
Constraints
-99 <= xa <= 99
-99 <= ya <= 99
-99 <= xb <= 99
-99 <= yb <= 99
-99 <= x <= 99
-99 <= y <= 99
Example
Input
2 -2 17 -3
0 7
-3 -8
75 32
-4 -13
17 92
Output
The point (0,7) is on the line (A,B).
The point (-3,-8) is on the line (A,B).
The point (-4,-13) is on the line (A,B).
The point (17,92) is on the line (A,B).
